meanings.definition: Showing an ability to understand and share the feelings of others.
meanings.sent1: She is very empathetic towards her friends when they are sad.
meanings.sent2: The empathetic nurse comforted the patient during a difficult time.
meanings.sent3: The empathetic puppy licked the tears off its owner's face.
meanings.sent4: His empathetic nature was like a warm blanket on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The empathetic teacher always knew when her students needed extra support.

meanings.definition: Having the capacity to be sensitive to and understand another's feelings.
meanings.sent1: The empathetic child could easily tell when his friend was upset.
meanings.sent2: An empathetic response can make someone feel truly heard and understood.
meanings.sent3: The empathetic cat purred softly to comfort its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her empathetic eyes seemed to see right through people's emotions.
meanings.sent5: In times of crisis, an empathetic leader can bring a sense of calm to the situation.
